channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Britain Surveillance Law Reform Urged in Government-Ordered Report
item.description: The report endorsed government efforts to fight terrorism but said the laws regulating them were “incomprehensible” and could erode public confidence.
item.dc:creator: STEPHEN CASTLE

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Don’t Disrespect American Jews
item.description: Israel's president is a great conciliator, but he’s been a miserable failure when it comes to relations with non-Orthodox Jews.
item.dc:creator: SHMUEL ROSNER

item.title: Zhou Yongkang, Ex-Security Chief in China, Gets Life Sentence for Graft
item.description: Mr. Zhou, the highest-ranking official felled in China’s anticorruption campaign, was tried in secret in the city of Tianjin, the state news media reported.
item.category: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL FORSYTHE and AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: China Says It Killed North Korean Suspected of Illegally Crossing Border
item.description: The person was shot early Thursday after resisting arrest in the town of Helong in Jilin Province, the Helong government said.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: A North Korean soldier patrolling along the border with China. The shooting on Thursday follows a series of violent episodes linked to North Koreans entering China.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Don’t Disrespect American Jews
item.description: Israel's president is a great conciliator, but he’s been a miserable failure when it comes to relations with non-Orthodox Jews.
item.dc:creator: SHMUEL ROSNER

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: No Justice for Canada’s First Peoples
item.description: The Truth and Reconciliation Commission has finished its work, and there is every indication that native people will be left, once again, with vague promises.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS KING

item.title: Nusra Front Insurgents Carry Out Deadly Attack on Druse in Syria
item.description: Antigovernment activists said at least 20 Druse were killed on Wednesday night in Idlib Province, fueling fears for civilians and minority sects in the tumultuous region.
item.dc:creator: ANNE BARNARD

item.title: U.S. Weighing More Military Bases in Iraq to Fight ISIS, Top General Says
item.description: The move would require at least hundreds more American military trainers to help Iraqi forces retake cities lost to the Sunni militants.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: HELENE COOPER

item.title: Aung San Suu Kyi of Myanmar Meets With Xi Jinping in Beijing
item.description: For Ms. Aung San Suu Kyi, the visit is seen as a step in her transformation from global icon of democracy to credible candidate to be Myanmar’s next leader.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL FORSYTHE
item.media:description: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the leader of the Myanmar opposition, being greeted by President Xi Jinping of China in the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Thursday.

item.title: Nobel Laureate Resigns Post After Comments on Female Scientists
item.description: Tim Hunt, who stepped down as a professor at University College London, said women should be segregated in labs because they cry when criticized and are a romantic distraction.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY
item.media:description: Tim Hunt, a biochemist who was awarded a Nobel Prize in 2001.

item.title: Nepal Landslides Kill at Least 21, With Others Trapped or Missing
item.description: Heavy rains arriving with monsoon season were undermining hillsides, many of which may have been destabilized by a devastating April earthquake.
item.dc:creator: BHADRA SHARMA

item.title: Russian Groups Crowdfund the War in Ukraine
item.description: Several groups are running online campaigns to brazenly raise money for rebels in eastern Ukraine, helping succor a conflict that has killed thousands.
item.dc:creator: JO BECKER and STEVEN LEE MYERS
item.media:description: Pro-Russian rebels carried the flag of their self-proclaimed Republic of Novorossiya in Debaltseve, Ukraine, in February.

item.title: Papal Responses to Sexual Abuse in the Church
item.description: A tribunal set up by Pope Francis is the Vatican’s first mechanism to discipline negligent Roman Catholic bishops, rather than abusive priests.
item.dc:creator: KARIN ROBERTS

item.title: Marguerite Patten, Acclaimed British Food Writer and Home Economist, Dies at 99
item.description: Starting out during the rationing years of the 1940s and 1950s, Ms. Patten, who wrote more than 170 books, was one of Britain’s first television chefs.
item.dc:creator: WILLIAM GRIMES
item.media:description: During World War II, Marguerite Patten became known as the queen of ration-book cuisine for her simple, satisfying creations.

item.title: World Briefing: Syria: An American Dies in a Battle
item.description: The American, Keith Broomfield of Massachusetts, died June 3 in a battle in a Syrian village near the border town of Kobani.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Lebanon: U.S. Puts 3 Lebanese on Blacklist Over Hezbollah Links
item.description: The Treasury Department froze any assets the Lebanese might have under United States jurisdiction and prohibited Americans from doing business with them.
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: World Briefing: West Bank: Palestinian Is Killed
item.description: Israeli forces killed a member of the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas during a raid in the occupied West Bank on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Sudan: Attacks Uproot Thousands
item.description: Increasing attacks on civilians in the Darfur region have forced tens of thousands of people to flee their homes this year.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Poland: Officials Quit Over Scandal
item.description: Four government ministers and the speaker of the Parliament speaker tendered their resignations on Wednesday amid a revived 2014 scandal over secret recordings.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: News Analysis: Trainers Intended as Lift, but Quick Iraq Turnaround Is Unlikely
item.description: President Obama’s plan does not call for American troops to accompany Iraqi fighters onto the battlefield to call in airstrikes or advise them on combat operations.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: United States Army trainers and Iraqi recruits in April. President Obama plans an additional 450 trainers and other personnel.
